entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.

tweets.text:
We've taken the first step in developing our carbon offsetting strategy.

Our latest research sets out the different approaches to carbon offsetting, and the challenges and opportunities they present.

Read more on our blog: https://t.co/6VCLjJkyhK

#NetZero #EA2025 https://t.co/dHsr9mKQYv

Over the past few months we've been busy producing a new film highlighting our Natural Flood Management work on the River Twyver, a project which we've been undertaking in partnership with @GloucesterCity, the @EnvAgency and some amazing landowners!

Film: https://t.co/sYBIZGeS0m https://t.co/hOjI8CJAvc

tweets.text:
The coarse fish close season has started. This means it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive.  

Don‚Äôt forget, there are plenty of still waters or canal coarse fisheries where you can fish. 

Learn more: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB https://t.co/ujbBmr7aUX

This year, our #Fisheries Improvement Programme has invested over ¬£1.3m in 170 projects across England. 
With local partners, we have delivered improvements for fisheries, enhancing facilities and accessibility for existing and new anglers.

Find out more: https://t.co/bPVCtdw9t7 https://t.co/myXdqhHX5z

urls.title: | Environment Agency Board Member
urls.description: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs Environment, Food & Rural Affairs D irector of Floods and Water, Defra ‚Ä¢ Departmental Official Chair, Environment Agency ‚Ä¢ Representative of Organisation Chair, Highways England ‚Ä¢ Independent Member ‚Ä¢ sets the strategy, drives performance and holds the organisation to account; ‚Ä¢ provides stewardship for public funds and environmental outcomes. The Board is made up of a Chair, Chief Executive and up to 14 other members. The Board has a collegiate style. It

@BarryNL @MarkGale @pippamaslin @hackbridgestink @XRMerton @XRSutton @KingstonXR @XRCroydon @CroydonGreens @suttongreens @ElliotColburn @LibDems @EnvAgency The permit should be available here: https://t.co/JZ49D2bzt7
but is not responding. There is also a copy at https://t.co/e1ZrxbYoVS

@CleanIlkley @YorkshireWater @_RobbieMoore 
Robbie the Govt needs to reintroduce the National Rivers authority to regulate as opposed to @EnvAgency CllrAH

@BarryNL @MarkGale @pippamaslin @hackbridgestink @XRMerton @XRSutton @KingstonXR @XRCroydon @CroydonGreens @suttongreens @ElliotColburn @LibDems @EnvAgency They are in the @EnvAgency permit, and there isn't a quota of the number of times the limit can be exceeded. They just report that number in their reports to @EnvAgency.

Following the fire at a former waste site in #Telford last week our officers are also monitoring the #RiverSevern from south #Shrewsbury to north of #Gloucester to check for any environmental impacts

#Shropshire @TelfordWrekin @PHE_WestMids @shropsfire https://t.co/wb94TEmA0K
Not sure the @EnvAgency have that good for my mental health. https://t.co/stk5aZTUFZ

@plumeplotter @MarkGale @pippamaslin @hackbridgestink @XRMerton @XRSutton @KingstonXR @XRCroydon @CroydonGreens @suttongreens @ElliotColburn @LibDems @EnvAgency Ah, ok. Where are the limits and permitted exceedances for this listed?

@BarryNL @MarkGale @pippamaslin @hackbridgestink @XRMerton @XRSutton @KingstonXR @XRCroydon @CroydonGreens @suttongreens @ElliotColburn @LibDems @EnvAgency You're talking about a completely different issue (limits on ambient air pollution). @MarkGale was talking about the limit on emission concentration. The half-hour limit is 200 mg/m3 (not ¬µg/m3) and they exceeded that limit.

@MarkGale @pippamaslin @hackbridgestink @plumeplotter @XRMerton @XRSutton @KingstonXR @XRCroydon @CroydonGreens @suttongreens @ElliotColburn @LibDems @EnvAgency But this is the point exceeding the limit is not the issue. Exceeding the maximum number of permitted exceedances would be a problem. The data you've posted doesn't come close to that.

urls.title: United Utilities - <Work completed to protect homes from flooding>
urls.description: External flooding of homes in Rock View, Sefton should soon be a thing of the past, thanks to work that‚Äôs been completed by United Utilities.

tweets.text: A major sewer upgrade project is nearing completion in #MySefton, which should prevent the risk of external flooding to a number of homes. We‚Äôll continue to work with @seftoncouncil and @ENVAgencyNW to explore more solutions to reduce the risk of flooding. https://t.co/8sQ69XFRpQ https://t.co/7Qap8s8TO8

@uugroupplc @seftoncouncil @EnvAgencyNW You may want to ask for community feedback before you consider this a successful operation, in my opinion it was a mess from start to what I hope isn‚Äôt the finish! 
The community has been beyond patient with the constantly changing timelines!
